choices: Henry Barnaby
Odval
Emelyn Putzkammer
1.content:
Henry Barnaby led an average life. He was in his first year of University, was dating his best friend's sister and worked part time at a grocery store. He and his friends enjoyed talking about a variety of topics including time travel. Henry had always insisted that if he somehow found himself in the past that he would be able to use his modern knowledge to conquer the world.

Odval lived in the early twelfth century on the Mongolian steppes. Her tribe was in the middle of a war with their neighbouring tribe. The war was not going well for her tribe, resulting in nightly raids. It was in the middle of one of these raids that she hid from the raiders, wishing for a better and safer life.

Emelyn Putzkammer lived in the early part of the 16th century in the Holy Roman Empire. Her Father had gone off to join the Army, leaving her in charge of her younger brother Maximillian as they struggled with life in the midst of the Reformation. Amidst all the troubles of daily life, Emelyn prayed for an easier life, free from Religious prosecution.

One of these young women will get their wish and swap places with Henry Barnaby. The question is, who is the lucky one and will you follow them or Henry as he finds himself in his new time.
1.title: The initial set up

choices: Odval
Emelyn Putzkammer
11.content: So Henry gets shunted back in time to another era as another person. Who does he become?
11.title: Henry Barnaby

choices: a destroyed tribal village, no other survivors
a badly damaged tribal village, many survivors
the remains of a small encampment, enemies all around you
111.content:
You had been walking home from the bus stop when suddenly you found yourself crouched behind some large sacs. All around you could hear the sounds of fighting.

It was then that you noticed something else that was strange. Though it was dark, you could clearly see that your hands were different. They were smaller and their calluses showed that they were used to much labour. Looking down at yourself you saw that you were wearing simple and roughly sewn clothing. Despite everything you could plainly see the bulge of your chest. Feeling it you are shocked to confirm the presence of breasts.

The sounds of battle have ended and you can hear the pounding of horses' hooves in the distance. Standing up you look around and see...
111.title: Odval

choices: Knocking you out and taking you with him
offering you a place in his tribe
ordering his men to depart
1113.content:
Standing up you see that you are not alone. All around you are soldiers on horseback. One of them rides up to you and yanks you off the ground.

"A girl still lives here!" you hear them say in another language.

Struggling against the grip of the sweaty man holding you, you don't have time to wonder how you were able to understand thir language.

"Bring her to me!" calls out a deep and authoritative voice.

You are tossed to the ground by the hooves of another horse. Looking up you see the man on that horse dismount. Not sure what is going on you decide it is best to stand up.

"Very good!" grins the man, showing many missing teeth, "You have much spirit and courage to stand up to me! I like that!" From the way everyone is behaving you guess this man is their leader.

"Glad I could impress you so easily," you say back in a girls voice and the language of these men.

"And you speak!" exclaims the man, "Truly you are a trophy worthy of a warrior such as myself!"

"I am no one's trophy!" you reply, taking a step back only to be pushed down in the mud by another soldier.

"Well then, prove to me you are not a trophy! Stand up and fight!" retorts the leader.

You push yourself up again, only to be knocked down from behind again.

"If you cannot even stand then I think it best to kill you here and now!" spat the leader.

You jump to your feet and spin around quickly, catching the hand of the man who had been Knocking you over. Suddenly you are surrounded by snorting laughter.

"Very good!" smiles the leader before...
1113.title: enemies all around

choices: Tell him to get lost!
Do as you are told
11132.content:
His smile ends, "Because you are courageous, especially for a female, I give you a choice girl. You may join the rest of your tribe, and I promise you a swift death with no pain. Or, you may take a place your courage has earned you in our tribe. Make your choice, but remember, you get only one chance."

You look around you at the death and destruction. You can't survive here even if you escaped, and until you know what is going on, you have to survive and try to return to your life. You make the only choice you really have. You look up at him and say, "I will join your tribe."

He laughs, "Very good! My son needs a worthy wife to bear his children!" He turned to one of his men, "Take her to Bataar! Tell him I send him a worthy bride!"

You scream in frustration as a warrior scoops you up and tosses you over his saddle like a toy! You did not say you would be a wife! But as you feel your breasts being pressed into the saddle with each motion of the horse, you realize that you are in no position to argue. Not only that, but this is obviously a more primitive culture than you came from, and one where women do not have 'rights'. If you are to survive, you will have to do it as a woman, and what exactly that means in this strange culture, you have yet to learn.

After what seems like hours, you arrive at what must be their camp. You hear jeers thrown at the man who had taken you. At last, you stop at some kind of tent made from animal skins of some kind. The man gets down from the horse, then proceeds to pull you down and throw you over his shoulder. You pound vainly on his back until he pulls you off and stands you in front of him.

As he turns you around, you hear a man say, "What is the meaning of this intrusion?"

The man who brought you laughs and replies, "This is your intrusion Bataar!" He pushes you into the young man. He is huge and you feel very tiny and weak as he grabs you and looks closely at you.

Bataar smiles, "A worthy intrusion, but what is one more wench?"

The man who brought you laughs, "Your father thinks her worthy. He has named her as your bride."

Bataar looks surprised, then smiles at you, "You must have impressed father indeed!" To the other man, "Leave us alone. I must learn more about my new wife!" The other man left. Before you know what is happening, in one smooth motion, he rips the rags from your body. You yell, but do not protest. He grins, "Very nice indeed! And these rags are not worthy of your body! Come to my furs woman!"

What do you do?
11132.title: offering you a place in his tribe

choices: Other survivors come over to you
You are alone in an empty camp
11133.content:
"It seems you have quite the fighting spirit, little girl! Since you show such promise I will grant you your life and your freedom. Do not waste this gift I am giving you or you will forever regret it!" explains the leader before mounting his horse once more. "Let us depart the scene of this battle and feast on the glory of our fallen comrades!" he shouts out just before the entire group of them ride off into the mist.

Now alone again you allow your mind to focus once more on the strangeness of your situation. Falling to your knees from the stress of it all you wonder how you got to be where you are now and pray that it is only a dream from which you will wake shortly. Looking around you see that...
11133.title: ordering his men to depart

choices: You remember how to start a fire from an internet video
You can't remember how to start a fire
111332.content:
A chill runs through you when you finally take the chance to see the destruction around you. All around are destroyed tents and huts intermingled with broken bodies. You look back down at your own body, wondering how you came to be in this place and in this body.

The wind picks up, blowing away the mist and smoke, revealing the surrounding terrain. The rugged hills and forests are visible stretching for miles in every direction.

"What am I to do?" you ask the hills, in english.

After a few more moments you decide that you'll need to get to work if you are going to survive. Going over to one of the trampled tents you uncover a fire pit. After gathering some wood from other parts of the camp you wonder how to get the fire going.
111332.title: You are alone in an empty camp

choices: Waiting for the policeman to come over to you
Running off away from the policeman
Charging at the policeman
Calmly going over to one of the structures.
12.content:
You'd gone from a crouched position, hiding behind some satchels, the sounds of fighting clanging in your ears to a standing position on the edge of a long and hard black rock with what looked like yellow paint down the middle. Coming towards you, riding along the black rock is a huge beast of some sort. It's head is low to the ground and light blazing from its eyes. You stand in fear as it races towards you. Leaping to the side as it passes you land in some brush.

Looking down you see that you are dressed in some strange material. Not only that but your body seems to be different. Peering over your shoulder you see that you are carrying an ornate pack of some sort. You decide that it would be best to scout out the immediate area.

Leaving the brush you look around. On the other side of the black rock you see what seem to be a series of structures. In front of one of the structures you see another beast strange. You approach the beast stealthily, keeping low to the ground. Once nearer to the beast you see that it seems to be asleep. You back away from the beast carefully, not wanting to wake it.

Not sure where to go you turn and head off along the centre of the black rock. You then see, up ahead, someone walking towards you, along the edge of the black rock. They are wearing a strange rimmed headpiece and carrying small parcels around their waist. They spot you, point at you and shout out something. They then make a waving motion with their arms.

Scared, you look around in panic before...
12.title: Odval

choices: Head off in search of the church
Continue talking to the guy who helped you.
Find a place to sit down
Wander off elsewhere
13.content:
You'd gone from kneeling beside yours and your brother's bed, deep in prayer to standing inside a brilliantly lit room. Looking around you see strange porcelain objects lining one wall and a row of metal chambers lining the other. At the end you see sunlight pouring in through some sort of window. You walk over to it and look out at a shocking view. The room you are in appears to be raised high off the ground, even higher than a church steeple.

All around on the ground below you see strange buildings, many made entirely out of huge panes of what seems to be glass. In the distance you spot the steeple of a church, its height dwarfed by your strange elevation.

Turning from the mesmerizing sight you run out of the room and into a long hallway with doors lining each side. You spot someone walk out of one of the doors and head towards you. You run off down the hall in the other direction. Suddenly, the shiny metal doors you see in front of you open all on their own. You jump back in shock, hurriedly making the sign of the cross over and over again. The person you had seen passes you and goes through the doors just as someone comes out through them. Terrified you decide to follow the person through the strange doors.

Suddenly the doors close again and you feel like you are falling. You grip at a railing that is rimming the small room you find yourself in. Suddenly the falling sensation eases and the doors open again. Looking out the doors you see crowds of people, all talking and moving about in groups.

You make the sign of the cross as you exit the tiny room and walk in the direction most of the people seem to be coming from. Passing through yet another set of self-opening doors you find yourself outside.

"Kirche?" you ask passers-by desperately, not noticing your strange voice.

Finally someone hears your pleas and comes over to you. After a short conversation he politely points you in the direction of the nearest church.

Finally knowing something of your surroundings you...
13.title: Emelyn Putzkammer

info.brief_description: Someone from the modern era swaps places with someone from the past.
info.description:
Someone from modern times swaps places with someone from the past. You can choose to follow either the person from the past in the present or the person from the present in the past.

If you are following the person from the past, consider history to have taken place normally, otherwise it can be changed (but not too drastically).

Characters:
Henry Barnaby: modern day university student
Odval: 12th century Mongolian, tribe is at war with neighbouring tribe
Emelyn Putzkammer: 16th century German, middle of the Reformation

Base Rules:
1. Do not completely terminate a particular storyline.
2. Only 1 swap occurs
3. No personality changes
4. Try for good grammar
5. Keep it clean (minimal to no sex)
